TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer

TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer Class Reference

#include <DisplayObjectContainer.h>

Inheritance diagram for TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Base Abstract class all displayable container objects. DisplayObjectContainer differs from DisplayObject by having the capability of owning other DisplayObjects as children

Defines virtual methods that subclasses must override

  • drawSelf()

Initialization/Deinitialization

Functions that maintain initialization and deinitialization of the DisplayObject.

void TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer::deinit (  )  [virtual]

Deinitializes self and children.

Implements TenUI::DisplayObject.

void TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer::update (  )  [virtual]

Calls update() on all children.

Implements TenUI::DisplayObject.

Reimplemented in TenUI::UIComponent.

virtual void TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer::drawSelf (  )  [pure virtual]

Draws Self. Subclasses MUST override this function to specify how to draw itself. This function:

  • allows drawing of self and children to be overriden seperately.
  • is called by the draw().
  • is called BEFORE drawChildren() so that children appear in front of their parent.

Implemented in TenUI::UIComponent.

void TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer::drawChildren (  )  [virtual]

Draws Self. Subclasses can override this function to change how children are drawn. This function:

  • allows drawing of self and children to be overriden seperately.
  • is called by the draw().
  • is called AFTER drawSelf() so that children appear in front of their parent.

void TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer::redraw (  ) 

Requests redrawing.

void TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer::draw (  )  [virtual]

Calls drawSelf() and drawChildren() Subclasses should not override this method, but override drawSelf() or drawChildren()

Implements TenUI::DisplayObject.

void TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer::addChild ( shared_ptr< DisplayObject >  child  )  [virtual]

Adds DisplayObject as a child of this DisplayObjectContainer. Children inherit this DisplayObject's view. This means the following attributes of a child are relative to the parent:

  • XY
  • Scale
  • Rotation

void TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer::removeChild ( shared_ptr< DisplayObject >  child  )  [virtual]

Removes child from list of children.

Parameters:
child DisplayObject to remove from list of children

const vector< shared_ptr< DisplayObject > > & TenUI::DisplayObjectContainer::getChildren (  )  [virtual]

Gets list of children DisplayObjects.
